nt"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"sender","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"token","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"totalAmount","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"recipientCount","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"bytes32","name":"batchHash","type":"bytes32"}],"name":"BatchTransferToken","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"oldValue","type":"uint256"},{"indexed":false,"internalType":"uint256","name":"newValue","type":"uint256"}],"name":"MaxRecipientsUpdated","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"previousOwner","type":"address"},{"indexed":true,"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"OwnershipTransferred","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"}],"name":"Paused","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":false,"internalType":"address","name":"account","type":"address"}],"name":"Unpaused","type":"event"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address[]","name":"tokenAddresses","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"address[]","name":"tokenRecipients","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"tokenAmounts","type":"uint256[]"},{"internalType":"address[]","name":"ethRecipients","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"ethAmounts","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address[]","name":"recipients","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"amounts","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"batchTransferEth","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"payable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address[]","name":"tokenAddresses","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"address[]","name":"recipients","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"amounts","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"batchTransferMultiTokens","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"tokenAddress","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address[]","name":"recipients","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"amounts","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"batchTransferToken","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address payable","name":"to","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"emergencyWithdrawEth","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"tokenAddress","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"to","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"emergencyWithdrawToken","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"maxRecipients","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"owner","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"pause","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"paused","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"renounceOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"_maxRecipients","type":"uint256"}],"name":"setMaxRecipients","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"tokenAddress","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address[]","name":"recipients","type":"address[]"},{"internalType":"uint256[]","name":"amounts","type":"uint256[]"}],"name":"simpleBatchTransferToken","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"name":"unpause","outputs":[],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"stateMutability":"payable","type":"receive"}],"devdoc":{"author":"https://github.com/ujangdoubleday","details":"Implements ReentrancyGuard, Ownable, and Pausable for maximum security  Features: - Batch transfer ETH to multiple recipients - Batch transfer single ERC20 token to multiple recipients (2 modes) - Batch transfer multiple ERC20 tokens to multiple recipients - Combined batch transfer (ETH + multiple tokens in single transaction) - Pausable for emergency situations - Owner-controlled max recipients limit - Emergency withdrawal functions  Security: - ReentrancyGuard protects against reentrancy attacks - SafeERC20 protects against token transfer failures - Pausable allows owner to pause contract during emergencies - Extensive input validations (zero address, zero amount, array length checks) - No external calls after state changes (CEI pattern)","errors":{"EnforcedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is paused."}],"ExpectedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is not paused."}],"FailedCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted."}],"InsufficientBalance(uint256,uint256)":[{"details":"The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation."}],"OwnableInvalidOwner(address)":[{"details":"The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}]},"events":{"BatchTransferCombined(address,uint256,uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"batchHash":"Unique hash for this batch","ethAmount":"Total ETH transferred","sender":"Address that initiated the transfer","tokenCount":"Number of token transfers performed"}},"BatchTransferEth(address,uint256,uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"batchHash":"Unique hash for this batch (for tracking and audit purposes)","recipientCount":"Number of recipients","sender":"Address that initiated the transfer","totalAmount":"Total ETH transferred (in Wei)"}},"BatchTransferMultiToken(address,uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"batchHash":"Unique hash for this batch","sender":"Address that initiated the transfer","tokenCount":"Number of token transfers performed"}},"BatchTransferToken(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"batchHash":"Unique hash for this batch","recipientCount":"Number of recipients","sender":"Address that initiated the transfer","token":"Address of the ERC20 token transferred","totalAmount":"Total tokens transferred"}},"MaxRecipientsUpdated(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"newValue":"New value","oldValue":"Previous value"}},"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens(address[],address[],uint256[],address[],uint256[])":{"custom:gas-optimization":"Split into internal functions to avoid stack too deep","custom:security":"ETH transfers executed first, then token transfers (CEI pattern)","details":"Powerful function to transfer ETH and multiple tokens simultaneously. Useful for airdrops or payroll ","params":{"ethAmounts":"Array of ETH amounts in Wei (parallel with ethRecipients)  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - tokenAddresses, tokenRecipients, tokenAmounts must have the same length - ethRecipients, ethAmounts must have the same length - Both lengths <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in any recipient arrays or token addresses - No zero amounts - If ethRecipients not empty: msg.value must equal sum(ethAmounts) - If ethRecipients empty: msg.value must be 0 - Caller must have approved this contract for all token amounts  Use Case: Payroll with ETH for gas + stablecoins, or multi-token + ETH airdrops  Example: ``` // Approve tokens IERC20(tokenA).approve(contractAddress, 100e18);  // Prepare arrays address[] memory tokens = [tokenA]; address[] memory tokenRecips = [0xAAA...]; uint256[] memory tokenAmts = [100e18]; address[] memory ethRecips = [0xBBB..., 0xCCC...]; uint256[] memory ethAmts = [0.1 ether, 0.2 ether];  // Call with ETH contract.batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens{value: 0.3 ether}(     tokens, tokenRecips, tokenAmts,     ethRecips, ethAmts ); ``` ","ethRecipients":"Array of ETH recipients","tokenAddresses":"Array of ERC20 token addresses to transfer","tokenAmounts":"Array of token amounts (parallel with tokenAddresses)","tokenRecipients":"Array of token recipients (parallel with tokenAddresses)"}},"batchTransferEth(address[],uint256[])":{"custom:security":"Reentrancy protected, uses CEI pattern","details":"Transfers exact amounts to each recipient. Total msg.value must equal sum of amounts ","params":{"amounts":"Array of amounts in Wei for each recipient  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Arrays must not be empty - Array lengths must match - Recipients length <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in recipients - No zero amounts - msg.value must equal sum of all amounts  Example: ``` address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [0.1 ether, 0.2 ether]; contract.batchTransferEth{value: 0.3 ether}(addrs, amts); ``` ","recipients":"Array of recipient addresses (max length = maxRecipients)"}},"batchTransferMultiTokens(address[],address[],uint256[])":{"custom:security":"Each transfer is independent, if one fails all revert","details":"Each index is a separate transfer: tokenAddresses[i] -> recipients[i] for amounts[i] ","params":{"amounts":"Array of token amounts  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - All three arrays must have the same length - Arrays must not be empty - Total length <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in tokenAddresses or recipients - No zero amounts - Caller must have approved this contract for amounts[i] of tokenAddresses[i] for each i  Use Case: Transfer different tokens to different recipients in a single transaction  Example: ``` // Approve each token first IERC20(tokenA).approve(contractAddress, 100e18); IERC20(tokenB).approve(contractAddress, 200e18);  // Then call address[] memory tokens = [tokenA, tokenB]; address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [100e18, 200e18]; contract.batchTransferMultiTokens(tokens, addrs, amts); ``` ","recipients":"Array of recipient addresses","tokenAddresses":"Array of ERC20 token addresses"}},"batchTransferToken(address,address[],uint256[])":{"custom:security":"Contract temporarily holds tokens, but immediately distributes them (no state change between)","details":"More gas efficient than simpleBatchTransferToken. Contract pulls total amount first, then distributes ","params":{"amounts":"Array of token amounts for each recipient  Requirements: - Same as simpleBatchTransferToken - Caller must have approved this contract for sum(amounts) tokens  Gas Usage: Cheaper than simpleBatchTransferToken (1 transferFrom + N transfers vs N transferFrom)  Example: ``` // Approve first IERC20(token).approve(contractAddress, 1000e18);  // Then call address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [500e18, 500e18]; contract.batchTransferToken(token, addrs, amts); ``` ","recipients":"Array of recipient addresses","tokenAddress":"Address of ERC20 token contract"}},"constructor":{"details":"Sets msg.sender as owner (required by OpenZeppelin Ownable v5.x)"},"emergencyWithdrawEth(address,uint256)":{"custom:security":"Owner only, cannot be used to steal user funds as contract doesn't hold user funds","details":"Only owner can call. Useful if ETH is accidentally sent to the contract ","params":{"amount":"Amount in Wei to withdraw  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Destination must not be zero address ","to":"Destination address"}},"emergencyWithdrawToken(address,address,uint256)":{"custom:security":"Owner only, cannot be used to steal user funds as contract doesn't hold user funds","details":"Only owner can call. Useful if tokens are accidentally sent to the contract ","params":{"amount":"Amount to withdraw  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Token address must not be zero address - Destination must not be zero address ","to":"Destination address","tokenAddress":"Address of ERC20 token to withdraw"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"pause()":{"details":"Only owner can call. Used in emergency situations  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Contract must not already be paused"},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setMaxRecipients(uint256)":{"details":"Only owner can call this. Limit between 1-500 to prevent gas issues","params":{"_maxRecipients":"New maximum recipients value (must be 1-500)  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - _maxRecipients must be > 0 and <= 500"}},"simpleBatchTransferToken(address,address[],uint256[])":{"custom:security":"Uses SafeERC20 to handle non-standard tokens","details":"Each transfer goes directly from caller to recipient. Caller must approve contract for TOTAL amount ","params":{"amounts":"Array of token amounts for each recipient (in smallest unit, e.g., Wei for WETH)  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Token address must not be zero address - Arrays must not be empty - Array lengths must match - Recipients length <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in recipients - No zero amounts - Caller must have approved this contract for sum(amounts) tokens  Gas Usage: More expensive than batchTransferToken due to multiple transferFrom calls  Example: ``` // Approve first IERC20(token).approve(contractAddress, 1000e18);  // Then call address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [500e18, 500e18]; contract.simpleBatchTransferToken(token, addrs, amts); ``` ","recipients":"Array of recipient addresses","tokenAddress":"Address of ERC20 token contract"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"unpause()":{"details":"Only owner can call  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Contract must be paused"}},"stateVariables":{"maxRecipients":{"details":"Default 100, owner can update between 1-500. This limit prevents out-of-gas errors"}},"title":"BatchTransferContract","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"BatchTransferCombined(address,uint256,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when combined batch transfer (ETH + tokens) succeeds"},"BatchTransferEth(address,uint256,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when ETH batch transfer succeeds"},"BatchTransferMultiToken(address,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when multiple tokens batch transfer succeeds"},"BatchTransferToken(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when ERC20 token batch transfer succeeds"},"MaxRecipientsUpdated(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when max recipients limit is updated"}},"kind":"user","methods":{"batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens(address[],address[],uint256[],address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Combined batch transfer: ETH + multiple tokens in a single transaction"},"batchTransferEth(address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Batch transfers ETH to multiple recipients"},"batchTransferMultiTokens(address[],address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Batch transfers multiple different tokens to multiple recipients"},"batchTransferToken(address,address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Batch transfer: Pulls total tokens to contract, then distributes to recipients"},"constructor":{"notice":"Initializes contract with deployer as owner"},"emergencyWithdrawEth(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emergency withdraws ETH stuck in contract"},"emergencyWithdrawToken(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emergency withdraws ERC20 tokens stuck in contract"},"maxRecipients()":{"notice":"Maximum number of recipients allowed per batch operation"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pauses all batch transfer operations"},"setMaxRecipients(uint256)":{"notice":"Updates maximum recipients limit"},"simpleBatchTransferToken(address,address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Simple batch transfer: Transfers ERC20 token to multiple recipients (direct transferFrom)"},"unpause()":{"notice":"Unpauses batch transfer operations"}},"notice":"Contract for efficient batch transfers of ETH and ERC20 tokens","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"src/BatchTransferContract.sol":"BatchTransferContract"},"evmVersion":"prague","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[":@openzeppelin/contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/",":erc4626-tests/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/erc4626-tests/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":halmos-cheatcodes/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/halmos-cheatcodes/src/",":openzeppelin-contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/"],"viaIR":true},"sources":{"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/Ownable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xff6d0bb2e285473e5311d9d3caacb525ae3538a80758c10649a4d61029b017bb","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8ed324d3920bb545059d66ab97d43e43ee85fd3bd52e03e401f020afb0b120f6","dweb:/ipfs/QmfEckWLmZkDDcoWrkEvMWhms66xwTLff9DDhegYpvHo1a"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IERC1363.sol":{"keccak256":"0xd5ea07362ab630a6a3dee4285a74cf2377044ca2e4be472755ad64d7c5d4b69d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://da5e832b40fc5c3145d3781e2e5fa60ac2052c9d08af7e300dc8ab80c4343100","dweb:/ipfs/QmTzf7N5ZUdh5raqtzbM11yexiUoLC9z3Ws632MCuycq1d"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0afcb7e740d1537b252cb2676f600465ce6938398569f09ba1b9ca240dde2dfc","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://1c299900ac4ec268d4570ecef0d697a3013cd11a6eb74e295ee3fbc945056037","dweb:/ipfs/Qmab9owJoxcA7vJT5XNayCMaUR1qxqj1NDzzisduwaJMcZ"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1a6221315ce0307746c2c4827c125d821ee796c74a676787762f4778671d4f44","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://1bb2332a7ee26dd0b0de9b7fe266749f54820c99ab6a3bcb6f7e6b751d47ee2d","dweb:/ipfs/QmcRWpaBeCYkhy68PR3B4AgD7asuQk7PwkWxrvJbZcikLF"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x74ed01eb66b923d0d0cfe3be84604ac04b76482a55f9dd655e1ef4d367f95bc2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5282825a626cfe924e504274b864a652b002359 xa516cbf1c7d15d3517c2d668601ce016c54395bf5171918a14e2686977465f53","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://1e1d079e8edfb58efd23a311e315a4807b01b5d1cf153f8fa2d0608b9dec3e99","dweb:/ipfs/QmTBExeX2SDTkn5xbk5ssbYSx7VqRp9H4Ux1CY4uQM4b9N"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/StorageSlot.sol":{"keccak256":"0xcf74f855663ce2ae00ed8352666b7935f6cddea2932fdf2c3ecd30a9b1cd0e97","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://9f660b1f351b757dfe01438e59888f31f33ded3afcf5cb5b0d9bf9aa6f320a8b","dweb:/ipfs/QmarDJ5hZEgBtCmmrVzEZWjub9769eD686jmzb2XpSU1cM"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8891738ffe910f0cf2da09566928589bf5d63f4524dd734fd9cedbac3274dd5c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://971f954442df5c2ef5b5ebf1eb245d7105d9fbacc7386ee5c796df1d45b21617","dweb:/ipfs/QmadRjHbkicwqwwh61raUEapaVEtaLMcYbQZWs9gUkgj3u"]},"src/BatchTransferContract.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf12353845ac64415a15e456767f4c55a8cb2f342ece0e34778b75bf1c5354697","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b340a7747711307284b2d1499f309cfa8d5f13cab5a9a7e407652d6118e2be83","dweb:/ipfs/QmWy2DfeuE7EdDBccVv6FTzdVMuuJC8sPww38TGfYfFFCG"]}},"version":1}

batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens(address.custom:gas-optimization: Split into internal functions to avoid stack too deep
batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens(address.custom:security: ETH transfers executed first, then token transfers (CEI pattern)
batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens(address.details: Powerful function to transfer ETH and multiple tokens simultaneously. Useful for airdrops or payroll

params.ethAmounts: Array of ETH amounts in Wei (parallel with ethRecipients)  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - tokenAddresses, tokenRecipients, tokenAmounts must have the same length - ethRecipients, ethAmounts must have the same length - Both lengths <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in any recipient arrays or token addresses - No zero amounts - If ethRecipients not empty: msg.value must equal sum(ethAmounts) - If ethRecipients empty: msg.value must be 0 - Caller must have approved this contract for all token amounts  Use Case: Payroll with ETH for gas + stablecoins, or multi-token + ETH airdrops  Example: ``` // Approve tokens IERC20(tokenA).approve(contractAddress, 100e18);  // Prepare arrays address[] memory tokens = [tokenA]; address[] memory tokenRecips = [0xAAA...]; uint256[] memory tokenAmts = [100e18]; address[] memory ethRecips = [0xBBB..., 0xCCC...]; uint256[] memory ethAmts = [0.1 ether, 0.2 ether];  // Call with ETH contract.batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens{value: 0.3 ether}(     tokens, tokenRecips, tokenAmts,     ethRecips, ethAmts ); ```
params.tokenAddresses: Array of ERC20 token addresses to transfer
params.tokenAmounts: Array of token amounts (parallel with tokenAddresses)
params.tokenRecipients: Array of token recipients (parallel with tokenAddresses)

batchTransferEth(address[],uint256[]).details: Transfers exact amounts to each recipient. Total msg.value must equal sum of amounts

params.amounts: Array of amounts in Wei for each recipient  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Arrays must not be empty - Array lengths must match - Recipients length <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in recipients - No zero amounts - msg.value must equal sum of all amounts  Example: ``` address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [0.1 ether, 0.2 ether]; contract.batchTransferEth{value: 0.3 ether}(addrs, amts); ```
params.recipients: Array of recipient addresses (max length = maxRecipients)

batchTransferMultiTokens(address[],addre.custom:security: Each transfer is independent, if one fails all revert
batchTransferMultiTokens(address[],addre.details: Each index is a separate transfer: tokenAddresses[i] -> recipients[i] for amounts[i]

params.amounts: Array of token amounts  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - All three arrays must have the same length - Arrays must not be empty - Total length <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in tokenAddresses or recipients - No zero amounts - Caller must have approved this contract for amounts[i] of tokenAddresses[i] for each i  Use Case: Transfer different tokens to different recipients in a single transaction  Example: ``` // Approve each token first IERC20(tokenA).approve(contractAddress, 100e18); IERC20(tokenB).approve(contractAddress, 200e18);  // Then call address[] memory tokens = [tokenA, tokenB]; address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [100e18, 200e18]; contract.batchTransferMultiTokens(tokens, addrs, amts); ```

batchTransferToken(address,address[],uin.custom:security: Contract temporarily holds tokens, but immediately distributes them (no state change between)
batchTransferToken(address,address[],uin.details: More gas efficient than simpleBatchTransferToken. Contract pulls total amount first, then distributes

params.amounts: Array of token amounts for each recipient  Requirements: - Same as simpleBatchTransferToken - Caller must have approved this contract for sum(amounts) tokens  Gas Usage: Cheaper than simpleBatchTransferToken (1 transferFrom + N transfers vs N transferFrom)  Example: ``` // Approve first IERC20(token).approve(contractAddress, 1000e18);  // Then call address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [500e18, 500e18]; contract.batchTransferToken(token, addrs, amts); ```

constructor.details: Sets msg.sender as owner (required by OpenZeppelin Ownable v5.x)

emergencyWithdrawEth(address,uint256).custom:security: Owner only, cannot be used to steal user funds as contract doesn't hold user funds
emergencyWithdrawEth(address,uint256).details: Only owner can call. Useful if ETH is accidentally sent to the contract

params.amount: Amount in Wei to withdraw  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Destination must not be zero address

emergencyWithdrawToken(address,address,u.custom:security: Owner only, cannot be used to steal user funds as contract doesn't hold user funds
emergencyWithdrawToken(address,address,u.details: Only owner can call. Useful if tokens are accidentally sent to the contract

params.amount: Amount to withdraw  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Token address must not be zero address - Destination must not be zero address
params.tokenAddress: Address of ERC20 token to withdraw

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause().details: Only owner can call. Used in emergency situations  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Contract must not already be paused

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setMaxRecipients(uint256).details: Only owner can call this. Limit between 1-500 to prevent gas issues

params._maxRecipients: New maximum recipients value (must be 1-500)  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - _maxRecipients must be > 0 and <= 500

simpleBatchTransferToken(address,address.custom:security: Uses SafeERC20 to handle non-standard tokens
simpleBatchTransferToken(address,address.details: Each transfer goes directly from caller to recipient. Caller must approve contract for TOTAL amount

params.amounts: Array of token amounts for each recipient (in smallest unit, e.g., Wei for WETH)  Requirements: - Contract must not be paused - Token address must not be zero address - Arrays must not be empty - Array lengths must match - Recipients length <= maxRecipients - No zero addresses in recipients - No zero amounts - Caller must have approved this contract for sum(amounts) tokens  Gas Usage: More expensive than batchTransferToken due to multiple transferFrom calls  Example: ``` // Approve first IERC20(token).approve(contractAddress, 1000e18);  // Then call address[] memory addrs = [0xAAA..., 0xBBB...]; uint256[] memory amts = [500e18, 500e18]; contract.simpleBatchTransferToken(token, addrs, amts); ```

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause().details: Only owner can call  Requirements: - Caller must be owner - Contract must be paused

batchTransferCombinedMultiTokens(address.notice: Combined batch transfer: ETH + multiple tokens in a single transaction

batchTransferEth(address[],uint256[]).notice: Batch transfers ETH to multiple recipients

batchTransferMultiTokens(address[],addre.notice: Batch transfers multiple different tokens to multiple recipients

batchTransferToken(address,address[],uin.notice: Batch transfer: Pulls total tokens to contract, then distributes to recipients

constructor.notice: Initializes contract with deployer as owner

emergencyWithdrawEth(address,uint256).notice: Emergency withdraws ETH stuck in contract

emergencyWithdrawToken(address,address,u.notice: Emergency withdraws ERC20 tokens stuck in contract

maxRecipients().notice: Maximum number of recipients allowed per batch operation

simpleBatchTransferToken(address,address.notice: Simple batch transfer: Transfers ERC20 token to multiple recipients (direct transferFrom)
